title: (x) Denihan Hospitality Group - Bulmer {Yves}
content:
I'm setting my timer. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Denihan.jpg)

Edit: I've attached a new version I created with Century STD Book by Adobe (Denihan2.pdf). It's close, but it's a little lighter and the edges on the original are much softer.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Denihan.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123/http:/typophile.com/files/Denihan_0.jpg) | 7.49 KB |
| [Denihan.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123/http:/typophile.com/files/Denihan.pdf) | 25.16 KB |
| [Denihan2.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123/http:/typophile.com/files/Denihan2.pdf) | 76.99 KB |
author: Fisheye

comments.content: You better show us the font too... :-)
the cap E has a splayed middle bar, right?

I think it's [Monotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Monotype)'s [Bulmer Semi Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.8406.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=24&sampleText=HOSPITALITY+GROUP&sampleSize=32), and even if it isn't, it comes pretty darn close.

Confirmed. Although the Adobe version, [Bulmer Std Semibold](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035123/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1307.html?newsample=GROUP&x=0&y=0) seems to be precisely what was used.
